ContentIndex.summary: NOTE Experimental The ContentIndex interface of the Content Index API allows developers to register their offline enabled content with the browser.

remarks.para:
-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexAdd.summary:
NOTE Experimental The add() method of the
interface registers an item with the content index.

remarks.para:
-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexAdd.returns: Returns a that resolves with undefined.

ContentIndexDelete.summary:
NOTE Experimental The delete() method of the
interface unregisters an item from the currently indexed
content.

blockquote.para:
Calling delete() only affects the index. It does not delete anything
from the .

remarks.para:
-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexDelete.returns: Returns a that resolves with undefined.

ContentIndexGetAll.summary:
NOTE Experimental The getAll() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref('Promise')}} that resolves with
an iterable list of content index entries.

remarks.para:
-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexGetAll.returns:
Returns a that resolves with an of
contentDescription items.
